title: Change in 1Password Extension Behavior
content:
Hello!

My 1Password Extension now requires me to click the 1Password icon at the far right of the Firefox nav bar. This, rather than simply autofilling the field(s) in question. In other words, it no longer "calls" 1Password and picks the correct, corresponding record in 1P, asking to confirm the autofill.

This is a new behavior that seems to coincide with a recent Firefox update and/or update to MACOS 26, but I can't be sure.

I absolutely detest this new 'functionality'.

Could this bee (: something wrong and not intentional?
creator: d68zknz2ck

title: what the heck happened to my bloody computer?!
content: Mozilla: you folks have destroyed my confidence in the Firefox operations: i'm retired, in my eighth decade of life; i live alone, on a farm with a handful of dogs and cattle -- i have NO DAMNED time to relearn computer science and how to convert to new platforms and such. evidently, my mozilla 10 is no longer supported so you're forcing me to change to a new platform: i don't do well with 'change', and all i want is my computer to look and operate as i've been happy with over the last decade! after your FORCED changes to my computer, i'm now required to implement operations and format that look as familiar to me as the hindi language, of which i have not one electron's knowledge! all the heck i want is for my bloody computer to work again. So, i'm gonna have to take my bloody computer 80 miles to get your forced changes implemented, so that i can get the professional help (probably 'mental', too!) to get my system back to some semblance of operational recognition. i've been happy with mozilla for the last decade; but your instructions for updating browsers and such, have been useless and painful for me! i just want to get back to the way my system looked a week ago -- and i'm too damned old to learn new tricks at this point in life! whatever happened to the days when i could click on a link and my system would be automatically updated, without my having to take a semester's course in computer science? again, i've been happily using mozilla for the last decade; but i'll probably have to move on to some other, inferior product... nonetheless, i have enjoyed mozilla for the last decade. 'Chuess'. grafunger@yahoo.com, wayout, TX.
creator: grafunger

title: My website shows “Not Secure” in Firefox even though it’s using Cloudflare SSL
content:
Hi everyone,

I’m using Cloudflare SSL for my website https://snaptubeapkmody.com, but Firefox still marks it as “Not Secure” instead of showing the padlock icon. The site loads with HTTPS, and SSL seems active on Cloudflare’s end.

I’ve already enabled “Always Use HTTPS” and “Automatic HTTPS Rewrites,” and everything looks fine when I check my Cloudflare dashboard. I also tried clearing the browser cache and testing in private mode, but the warning still appears.

Could anyone guide me on what might be causing this issue or how to fix it in Firefox?

Thanks in advance!

title: Firefox freezes when saving files or changing default save location
content:
Mozilla Firefox freezes for 5 to 6 seconds when downloading / saving files or changing the default "Save to" location.

Other programs (i.e. MS Word, MS Excel, Chrome) don't suffer from the same issue.

  • I have mapped drives from my NAS on the same network.
  • "Automatic Destinations" folder has been cleared
  • Looking at the performance stats in Task Manager, CPU and memory usage values are normal.
  • Antivirus / firewall software disabled to no affect

Here is the profiler.firefox.com report: https://www.idrive.com/idrive/sh/sh?k=a2a6j1j3o3
creator: firefox3084
